info.name: Sunbird-ED-Portal-Object_Category_definition-Form-Configuration-V1.0.0
info.description:
#### Overview

This guide provides a comprehensive overview of the Object Category Definition Configuration.

#### What is the Object category definition?

The Object Category Definition object allows to set the specific behavior and form configuration for different types of objects like Asset, Content, Collection, Questions, and Question Sets.

#### Why do you need it?

Configuring these objects allows us to have specific behavior for different types of objects for a particular category. Also it allows us to configure forms to create, update, review, or publish the different objects existing in the Sunbird ED portal, such as Asset, Content, Collection, Questions, and Question Sets.

item.description:
This is a list of Object Category Definition Read API. This will be triggered before creation of the objects. Ideally all the APIs response status should be 404 (RESOURCE_NOT_FOUND).

There is a sample example with responses from the SunbirdED staging environment. It can be referred for reference.

item.description:
This is a list of Object Category Definition Create API. On execution of these APIs, all the Object Category Definition objects will be created in the system. The schema and form configuration in the request payload is taken from the SunbirdED staging environment.

Adopters can change their respective configuration in request payload according to their requirement.
